pyzui.tilestore module¶

Module for managing the disk-based tile storage facility.

pyzui.tilestore.get_media_path(media_id)[source]¶

Return the path to the directory containing the tiles for the media identified by media_id.

get_media_path(string) -> string

pyzui.tilestore.get_tile_path(tile_id, mkdirp=False, prefix=None, filext=None)[source]¶

Return the path to the tile identified by tile_id.

If mkdirp is True, then any non-existent parent directories of the tile will be created.

If prefix is omitted, it will be set to the value returned by get_media_path.

If filext is omitted, it will be set to the value returned by get_metadata.

get_tile_path(tuple<string,int,int,int>[, bool[, string[, string]]]) -> string

Precondition: if filext is None, then the metadata file for the media that this tile belongs to exists and contains an entry for filext

pyzui.tilestore.load_metadata(media_id)[source]¶

Load metadata from disk for the given media_id, and return a bool indicating whether the load was successful.

load_metadata(string) -> bool

pyzui.tilestore.get_metadata(media_id, key)[source]¶

Return the value associated with the given metadata key, None if there is no such value.

get_metadata(string, string) -> object or None

pyzui.tilestore.write_metadata(media_id, **kwargs)[source]¶

Write the metadata given in kwargs for the given media_id.

write_metadata(string, metadata_key=metadata_val, …) -> None

pyzui.tilestore.tiled(media_id)[source]¶

Return True iff the media identified by media_id has been tiled i.e. iff both a metadata file and the (0,0,0) tile exist.

tiled(string) -> bool
